comments:
I had this appear in the console I lauched eclipse from. No log so I can't
really say what I was doing at the time.

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:77)

This can occur if a Job returns null as a result. We need to protect against it,
or  log a more detailed exception if a job returns null. The spec of Job.run
should be updated to say a job must never return null. After doing a code
review, I see that 
DelayedSnapshotJob can return null in failure cases.

CC DJ for RC2 fix approval (at least protect against the NPE)

Fixed. Three changes:

DelayedSnapshotRunnable.run - result was initially assigned to null, but further
analysis showed that all code paths eventually assigned a value. To make it
clearer, I initially assigned the result to Status.OK_STATUS. This has no
effect, but makes it clear that it cannot return null.

Worker.run - handle NullPointerException more elegantly and log it.

There may still be a job out there that returns a null result, but it will now
be logging this case rather than just dying.
